similaranime.anime: Papa no Iu Koto o Kikinasai!
Udon no Kuni no Kin`iro Kemari
Uchi no Ko no Tame Naraba, Ore wa Moshikashitara Maou mo Taoseru Kamo Shirenai.

recommendations.recommendation: So much daaaaaaw. If that`s your kind of thing, you`ll love this show.
A very heartwarming anime. Learns you that life is more beautiful than what you think.

I`m not used to this type of animation/artwork after watching shows like HotD and Angel Beats, but despite the art style, this show is a must see for parents. Teens and non-parents won`t appreciate it, but i loved this show.

Well done story, relatable characters and realistic, well presented dialog. Thankfully while it follows the manga fairly closely it doesn`t include the incest romance storyline at all, though the ending will probably leave you wanting a bit more. Definitely worth watching.
Usagi Drop has portrait the family value and sudden responsible in really heart warming way. It teaches you about the responsibility and the trouble that you face and the happiness you gain with it.

After 2 episodes, I started to like this show. Sure, the animation style is not for average anime lover, but I found its unique style is perfect for the story. Add the fact that Production I.G involved in this project, this show is a recommended.

10/10 : Being in my 20`s seeing something like this makes you want a kid in a special parenting sense. This is a very warm series for anyone with or without kids, Rin is adorable throughout the entire series, and Dai is a man among men for what he did during it all. I recommend this to anyone wanting a bit of warmth in their anime , beware though you may have an urge for a little girl in the future. XD

This anime/manga is not for the average action/ecchi loving anime viewer.
This anime will most likely as a male viewer want to make you have a daughter to care for.
If this anime triggers that feeling for you in the first 2 eps, you wont regret watching it.
真的是很棒的一部动画，温馨平凡但又令人感动。 狗咖喱负责分镜的OP/ED更为动画增添了一抹淡彩。
Very positive and clever anime. It surprises with characters, easy-to-follow plot and funny texts. After watching you only regret it finished. Really good one.

What a beautiful little show. I missed so many years of my 2 girls growing up, and watching this was both heart-warming, and very sad. I wish I could get that time back! I recommend this for anyone who has or likes kids. Sure wish Kouki`s mom and Rin`s guardian would get together!
I watched this anime in one sunday... Nice and relaxing.
If you`re into Slice of Life that isn`t just moe pandering, you will love Usagi Drop. It`s a heartwarming and lovely story, supported by great animation and a hugable design.
nice storryyy

*First, check to see if we share similar anime tastes.* I was VERY surprised with how good this was. Normally, slice-of-life anime bore me to tears, but this anime moved me to tears (the good ones). If you`re a parent, then you might like this anime.
As a someone who works on the educational field, I must recommend this series to everyone because of it`s positive outlook on everyday life.

Usagi Drop may be the best series in terms of emotional realism in the daily life anime genre. With that said, there are other genres that have better or more realistic emotional realism. It depends what genre you’re looking for.
I scored UD an 8 because the story is incomplete, meaning that there are plot lines that are started and not finished. The finale seems open-ended not to suggest a continuation of the same but that there is more story to come. Still, I am grateful that the anime did not follow the ending of the manga, since the mangaka took the series in a ridiculous and unbelievable direction. Search that out at your own peril.
UD is lovely, heart-warming, and well produced at all levels. However, I don’t think it merits as high a ranking as it has received. If you’re interested in the best anime you’d be better off seeking out the lower rated but superior Cowboy Bebop, Shin Sekai Yori, or Revolutionary Girl Utena.

Anime masterpieces never fail to amaze. Actually I have not visited AniDB for close to a year I think. When I return and tada, we can add this `recommendation` comment. Great. Each episode has underlying meaning to it. This is call Pure Love. And it is beyond age and background. I know how the sentiment of the author goes, as this sentiment is how I would feel as well. In our society, it is very sad that selfless pure love would hardly exist anymore. As always like all great anime masterpieces, the hidden but very strong notion of sentiment is expressed (whole lot different from Western animations). So the moral of this piece is, simply amazing.
Anyway, a note to all newbies, never state spoilers such as endings in your comments! I still see it happening, please do AniDB a favor even as no administrator would be checking at this time.
Slice of life of a single guy looking after a child.
A very heat-warming anime to watch. This is quite laid back. It`s like a reading a novel! A good watch

One of the most endearing shows that I have seen. The father-daughter relationship in Usagi Drop is pure and at times makes you want to have a child. There is no real plot, and my guess is that this is one of the points in the show. Life is not about any thing in specific, it is about the small precious moments you spent with your loved ones.
Excellent series, something fresh and heartwarming at the same time, Not to mention the wonderful visual style and the great character design, I`m hooked!

I would not holler for other people to watch what they think they don`t like but I guess I can`t just say not to try this because the series have so many small things that people tend to not notice or nearly forgot which this series actually animates a part of true life very well. As many others already mentioned, this is not a series where there is a lot of "wow" factor but this series proves to be the one of the most meaningful and inspiring series I have ever watched beyond the subtle tones of the pastel-like colors of the show.
Simply amazing, ending at a perfect spot.
If you`re looking for a heart-warming slice of life anime; this is it. Made me want to adopt a kid ;)
Loved for some reason , maybe graphics/type of story
It is said that genius ideas are simple yet have a huge impact, that is exactly what this anime is.
There`s something magical about this series. It makes you think about the little things that make life great.

Oh yeah - it`s that good! But you don`t have to believe me, just go and see for yourself. It`s a shame that if a second season comes and goes by the manga won`t reach the level of this masterpiece as there will be many who will dislike the conclusion.
Very cute and heart warming anime, too bad I could not rate it more than 10! :D

I really loved this series. Wish there could be a second season tho. This show and Aishiteruze baby are 2 series that REALLY makes me wanna move to japan and have a family of my own, it is that heartwarming and i would love to see more of this series
It`s a truly delightful series! I love animes like this!

Although I spent the whole series waiting for daikichi`s love live to progress with a certain yummy mummy, the relationship development between the main two characters is amazing. Truly one of the best series I`ve seen recently, however being a father myself I can`t help but wonder if some of the gags that made the series so watchable would go completely over a non-parents head? I mean, we`ve all been there, running gasping for breath to pickup your son/daughter. It was a really heartwarming show, but I just just wish there was more mama in it!

This is the only anime I`ve watched so far that truly has literally no faults. I can`t recall a single moment I would have liked to see happen differently. You get drawn into this anime from the very first minute of the first episode. You start living with the characters, who have been designed perfectly. You can relate to all of their actions, they`re all extremely lovable and you may even recall some of your own memories. It`s just that it`s so short. I ran through the entire anime and when it ended I felt like I just watched one or two episodes. This is definitely a must see, recommended to fans of any genre and especially to people who are just starting to get into anime.

this series is really a must see... so beautiful...so much beautifulness that I can`t express with words...it`s just so awesome... you won`t regret after watching it and most likely give a similiar recommendation like most of us did... :)
Recommended to people who want to get married or to have a child! It is a nice and useful anime for teaching some serious lessons. And to spend time for fun!

Incredibly heartwarming, enough to touch a 20-year-old metal head like myself. One of the best animes this season, for sure. I`m usually not all that much for these types of stories, but this one is an exception. Very interesting artwork and lovely music. I really want to recommend watching this even if you usually prefer stories like Hellsing, Code Geass, etc. such as myself.

Truly amazing story with loveable characters, awesome story filled with just niceness (what is that?!) no heavy charges of wrong emotions to the heart, they should make them all EXACTLY like Usagi Drop. Just Beautiful... Needed another 1000 episodes though...
Starts off bored me to death, yet, as it slowly reveals social problems within our society(especially the Asian ones), I was touched, really touched. A must see show for most of us indeed.
Heartwarming slice of life. Just who`s being raised here by whom, the toddler or the adult? The two quickly learn to live with each other, and the series chronicles both their ups and downs.

This anime is just SO unbelievably cute. Amazing charaters... and the animation is BEAUTIFUL. The art style looks somewhat abstract and yet it covers the smallest minute details of environment and everyday life (from train doors closing at a certain way to bending at a certain angle to sit down) in their scenes.... For Slice of Life fans everywhere: HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!
It`s a warm and touching story that will leave you asking for more.
Nice visual style to counteract the normal horrific fads. Lovely down to earth slice-of-life plot.
It`s a must see for whoever you are... the concept and story is simple, but the development and presentation what makes it top notch... it`s a beautiful and warm anime show...
Best anime I`ve seen for years!

Just read the recommendation of Yoruzugenga and got the feeling that he gave me a kick saying "Hey old Mecha Mom, watch this!" And damn, he was right! This anime is absolutely a must see. It brings a little peace in your mind and gives you the feeling that every thing will be alright. Especially for me, who is a Mom herself ^^ This story is far away from being boring, the animation is a peace of art. See it!
this feel-good bullshit is fantastic.
It`s good. For real. I usualy don`t like all that drama stuff, but it was made someway it just gets U, it does not force it into U.
Best slice of life anime yet to be beaten. 10/10

A refreshing anime, one that comes at a right time, when good anime is having more and more problems getting out. It is very relaxing. Follows the daily life of the main characters (Rin and Daikichi) as soon as they are together. It is a nice watch.
Really good anime Must watch Really heartwarming
Simply amazing, heartwarming.
One of the best show I`ve seen, very simple in his daylife situations but so charming for its characters and their development. The story always avoids to become too sugary (hard to see nowadays)
best anime this season.
One of the best shows I`ve seen in a long time. Perfect.
faultless
OMFG how can an anime can be this cute and funny never seen something like that. so peaceful

I usually watch sports and action anime but I fell for this anime just after the first minute! Loved the way it`s drawn and colored and the story shows promise. A heart warming anime that makes you feel good and leaves a smile on your face :)
I watched the entire show in one rainy afternoon. It touched me deeply.
Hands down the best Anime of 2011 summer season. People who liked Clannad After Story, or basically anyone who isn`t completely dead inside will like this heartwarming quickwatch.

I have watched anime since I was about 10 (that`s 14 years) and this is BY FAR the B-E-S-T anime I have ever watched. Like others have said; this isn`t an action anime or anything like that, but you will get addicted after the first episode. This is a very heartwarming and down to earth anime. It deals with true life issues and situations which makes you connect on a physical and emotional level to all the characters. Unfortunately the main draw back is the lack of episodes :( at the last episode I hated knowing it was the end. They sem to have a lot more space to grow the series, but then again I have yet to read the manga, so it might continue in the manga OR (like most manga to anime now-a-days) they saw the potential for an anime and made an anime without much story line. This means they may not have enough story to expand. Lets hope there is another season :D
Everyone is focused on ending but it doesn`t matter for real fans. The warmth, the intimacy and pureness is the vogue matter of this anime. You must see if you have a heart and a soul.
great anime nice story tobad it only 11ep top 5 in my anime list

anime.description: * Based on josei manga series Usagi Drop by http://anidb.net/cr12075 [Unita Yumi], serialised in Feel Young magazine. Going home for his grandfather`s funeral, thirty-year-old bachelor http://anidb.net/ch32124 [Daikichi] is floored to discover that the old man had an illegitimate child with a younger lover. The rest of his family is equally shocked and embarrassed by this surprise development, and not one of them wants anything to do with the silent little girl, http://anidb.net/ch32125 [Rin]. In a fit of angry spontaneity, Daikichi decides to take her in himself. But will living with this overgrown teenager of man help Rin come out of her shell? And will not this turn of events spell doom for Daikichi`s love life?

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: moe
tag.description: Moe is a Japanese slang loanword that refers to feelings of strong affection mainly towards characters in anime, manga, and video games. Moe, however, has also gained usage to refer to feelings of affection towards any subject. Moe can be related to lust; however, pure lust without other feelings is considered outside its scope. The word Moe originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s in Japan and is of uncertain origin, although there are several theories on how it came into use. At the anime level, the http://anidb.net/t7146 [cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] tag may also apply. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: josei
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word josei refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "woman", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: toilet humour
tag.description: Everything leads back to poo.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: summer festival
tag.description: The summer festival is used to show off the female protagonists in traditional Japanese clothing — the yukata — a casual form of kimono. The festivities include food stalls (cotton candy, candy apples, choco bananas, taiyaki), various games (scoop goldfishes), and a fireworks display.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: religion
tag.description: Religion is a collection of belief systems, cultural systems, and worldviews that relate humanity to spirituality and, sometimes, to moral values. Many religions have narratives, symbols, traditions and sacred histories that are intended to give meaning to life or to explain the origin of life or the universe. They tend to derive morality, ethics, religious laws or a preferred lifestyle from their ideas about the cosmos and human nature.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: Buddhism
tag.description: Buddhism is a nontheistic religion or dharma, "right way of living", that encompasses a variety of traditions, beliefs and practices largely based on teachings attributed to Siddhartha Gautama, commonly known as the Buddha ("the awakened one"). Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: preview in ed
tag.description: For some reason the director decided to show the preview during the ending sequence. In some cases the preview might be after the ending animation, but still during the ending theme.

tag.name: noitaminA
tag.description: noitaminA (ノイタミナ) – Animation written backwards – is a Fuji Television programming block, devoted to anime, broadcast each Thursday night from 00:45 to 1:15. It was launched with the intention of expanding the target audience beyond the typical young male demographic. The timeslot was expanded from half an hour to a full hour in 2010, and now airs Thursday nights from 00:45 to 1:45. noitaminA aired its first non-anime series in 2010, with the premiere of the live-action adaptation of Moyashimon. On April 15, 2010, Fuji TV and FUNimation announced an agreement that allows FUNimation to simulcast series from the noitaminA block in North America within an hour of their airing in Japan.

tag.name: mono no aware
tag.description: Literally "the pathos of things", also translated as "an empathy toward things," or "a sensitivity of ephemera"; a Japanese term used to describe the awareness of the transience of things and a gentle sadness (or wistfulness) at their passing. Also frequently been translated as "the `ahh-ness` of things".

tag.name: babysitting
tag.description: Babysitting is the practice of temporarily caring for a child on behalf of the child`s parents. Babysitting is commonly performed as an odd job by teenagers for extra money, stereotypically (but not necessarily) by girls.

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: subtle OP ED sequence change
tag.description: A (small) part of the opening or ending sequence changes after a certain episode, usually to reflect a plot milestone.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: parenting
tag.description: This anime is about parenting and its many challenges.

tag.name: preschool
tag.description: Preschool education (or infant education) is the provision of learning to children before the commencement of statutory and obligatory education, usually between the ages of zero and three or five, depending on the jurisdiction. In Japan, development of social skills and a sense of group belonging are major goals for preschools. Class sizes tend to be large, up to 40 students per class, to decrease the role of the teacher`s personality and increase the likelihood of peer interactions. Because exclusion from the group is extremely undesirable, a wide range of behaviors is tolerated. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: rock-paper-scissors
tag.description: Whenever a decision has to be made in anime, the Japanese protagonists seem to be awfully fond of playing rock-paper-scissors (or jan-ken-pon) to determine the outcome.

tag.name: family without mother
tag.description: For some reason, the protagonist`s mother is no longer among the living. The much-too-early death was due to sickness or accident. This plot device adds a certain degree of tragedy to the anime, and usually has repercussions on the rest of the family. For example: the grief-stricken father and children barely function as humans; the oldest daughter has an extra burden of raising the other children, additional emphasis is given to the only female child in the family, i.e. with bishounen brother and dad in a shoujo setting. In rare cases the mother may still be alive, just not living with the rest of the family presently, i.e. on some quest or job and gone for a long time.

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: piggyback ride
tag.description: One of the protagonists (usually male) gives another character (usually female) a ride on the back. Can be interpreted as a sign of closeness or endearment in a romance setting. Reasons: The female character is exhausted from previous running, or has a fit of anaemia, or hurt herself and no longer can walk.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Kawachi Daikichi
character.description: Daikichi is a 30-year-old single man and the adoptive guardian of Rin. With Rin living in his home, Daikichi quits smoking, cleans his house, and reluctantly cuts back on work hours. Despite his irresponsible life style, Daikichi is a very hard worker and considered the best in his department. He is insecure about his style on raising Rin, always asking his co-workers or Yukari for guidance. Yumi Unita stated some events Daikichi faced when raising Rin were based on her personal experiences. He appears to like Yukari.

character.name: Kaga Rin
character.description: Rin is a six-year-old girl and thought to be the illegitimate daughter of Daikichi`s grandfather, Souichi Kaga, and manga artist Masako Yoshii. Masako abandoned her for the sake of her career.

character.name: Nitani Yukari
character.description: Yukari is an attractive 32-year-old divorced woman who is Kouki`s mother. She gives guidance to Daikichi Kawachi on raising Rin.

character.name: Nitani Kouki
character.description: Kouki is a boy Rin befriended in her daycare. He is an immature brat, but has grown fond of Rin as they are both raised by a single parent.

character.name: Waitress
character.description: Waitress in the family restaurant where Daikichi meets Yoshii Masako.

character.name: Hahaoya
character.description: Mother with child in the park.

character.name: Otokonoko
character.description: Mother with a child in the park.

character.name: Sayaka
character.description: Sayaka is Rin`s classmate. Her father is a model.

character.name: Sayaka Papa
character.description: Sayaka`s father. He is a model.

character.name: Nabe-chin
character.description: Nabe-chin is father who has kid in the same grade as Rin is. He is friend with Sayaka`s father.

character.name: Nobu
character.description: Nobu is in the same grade as Rin.

character.name: Shidouin 1
character.description: Advisor in the after-school care which are Rin and Kouki attending. Note: Seiyuu (voice actor) is a singer from band PUFFY which recorded song for the intro video.

character.name: Shidouin 2
character.description: Advisor in the after-school care which are Rin and Kouki attending. Note: Seiyuu (voice actor) is a singer from band PUFFY which recorded song for the intro video.

episode.title: りんどうの女の子
The Bellflower Girl
Das Glockenblumenmädchen
Rindou no Onnanoko
episode.summary: 30-year-old bachelor businessman Kawachi Daikichi encounters Rin, a girl he`s never seen before, at his grandfather`s funeral. Surprisingly, the 6-year-old girl turns out to be his grandfather`s love child. Daikichi doesn`t like children, but the cold attitude of his relatives towards Rin makes him uncomfortable. And then, the relatives` meeting to decide who will have custody of Rin begins at last... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わたしの木
My Tree
Mein Baum
Watashi no Ki
episode.summary: When Rin enters elementary school, Daikichi proposes planting a tree to commemorate the occasion. Rin plants a loquat seed in the yard, but there`s no telling whether it will actually put forth buds. Thinking that perhaps Souichi planted something to mark Rin`s birth, Daikichi has another visit with Masako... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイキチはダイキチでいい
Daikichi is my Daikichi
Daikichi bleibt Daikichi
Daikichi wa Daikichi de Ii
episode.summary: Daikichi finally meets Rin`s mother, Masako, and he`s shocked by her frankness. When they part, Masako asks Daikichi for a favor, and it`s an issue that Daikichi can`t avoid, as long as he`s going to raise Rin. Daikichi tries to resolve it by having a heart-to-heart conversation with Rin, but he gets an unexpected answer... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: てがみ
Letter
Das Testament
Tegami
episode.summary: Rin befriends Kouki, a boy she met at the local nursery school, while Daikichi`s pulse races a bit when he meets Kouki`s beautiful single mother. Later, the modem Daikichi discovered at Souichi`s house leads him to his grandfather`s last words. And from there, he receives a contact number for Rin`s mother, Masako... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイキチの決めたこと
Daikichi`s Decision
Daikichis Entscheidung
Daikichi no Kimeta Koto
episode.summary: Daikichi goes back to his parents’ house with Rin in tow in order to search for clues about her mother. At first, his parents were opposed to him taking custody of the girl, but now they’re not entirely dissatisfied about having what amounts to a grandchild. And at Souichi’s house, Daikichi discovers a mystery modem. This leads him to think about his life with Rin and he makes an important decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆび切りげんまん
Pinky Promise
Versprochen ist versprochen
Yubikiri Genman
episode.summary: What kind of clothes to buy her? What to feed her? What to do about nursery school? Daikichi`s new life raising a 6-year-old girl is an uninterrupted stream of bewilderment. Rin looks anxious on her first day of nursery school, so Daikichi does a "pinky swear" with her, promising to pick her up as soon as he can. And Daikichi, who has no confidence he can live with Rin for long, starts thinking about meeting Rin`s mother... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おなかのかぜ
Stomach Flu
Der Infekt
Onaka no Kaze
episode.summary: Daikichi feels helpless when Rin is laid up with stomach flu, so Kouki`s mother steps in to give them both a hand. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たいふうがきた!
A Typhoon Came!
Der Taifun
Tai-fuu ga Kita!
episode.summary: At school, Rin is concerned that the disobedient Kouki is getting off track and getting a bad reputation. Meanwhile, when a typhoon hits, Kouki and his mom take shelter with Daikichi and Rin at their house. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おじいちゃんのだいじ
Grandpa`s Precious Thing
Großvaters Blume
Ojiichan no Daiji
episode.summary: During Rin`s summer vacation, Daikichi and Rin visit Souichi`s grave, where they find an ink bottle and bellflowers. Daikichi runs after Masako, Rin`s mother, who had just been there, and when he catches up, offers her an unusual proposal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ないしょで家出
Secretly Running Away From Home
Unvorhergesehene Gäste
Naisho de Iede
episode.summary: Daikichi`s cousin, Haruko, runs away from home to DaikichiÂ`s house with her daughter Reina in tow. Daikichi can hardly fathom Haruko`s determination, but when he does learn her reasons, he`s not a little surprised by how strong Haruko has become as a mother. It gets him thinking again about what marriage and family mean. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はじめの一歩
The First Step
Der erste Schritt
Hajime no Ippo
episode.summary: It`s the first anniversary of Grandpa`s death, which means Rin and Daikichi have been living together for about a year now. Daikichi mulls over what he`s lost and what he`s gained since Rin came into his life… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かえり道
The Way Back Home
Der Geheimplatz
Le chemin du retour
Kaeri Michi
episode.summary: After visiting a festival, Kouki is still not tired, so Daikichi suggests a little detour on their way home, thus showing Rin, Kouki and Yukari his "secret place".

episode.title: おそらにまんかい
Full Bloom in the Sky
Kirschblüten
Le ciel en floraison
Osora ni Mankai
episode.summary: As the cherry trees are in full blossom, Rin wants to go flower watching, and Kouki`s mother prepares a bentou for this purpose. But the weather forecast announced a spring storm, so Rin and Daikichi make good-weather charms.
